item.title: A Ceasar cipher implemented in Vue.js
item.description: Related to my recent interest in CTF, I’ve spent a little time to implement a simple Ceasar cipher in Vue.js. It allows the user to replace letters with another letter some adjustable number of positions up or down the alphabet. I did this partly because it’s a long time since I’ve done any Vue-related work and also because I find other online Ceasar cipher sites to be a bit clunky and not as user friendly.

item.title: I just did my first SQL injection!
item.description: … and it felt good! This week I spent a couple of hours finding my way through Norwegian Police Security Services new job application which required “hacking” to apply. See the solution on Reddit, GitHub and Kode24. I had a lot of fun trying to figure out the puzzles and it got me excited about learning more. While I liked the challenge, I do tend to like to learn in a more structured way.

item.title: A simple RDBMS queue pattern
item.description: I recently attended a MeetUp with Axel Fontaine where he briefly threw out an example of how to create a queue in an relational database. In this post I have a closer look at that idea and test it out in PostgreSQL. So this is the gist of the idea. A consumer would consume messages while placing locks on the rows being processed, leveraging the ACID properties of the database.

item.title: Setting up my blog with Hugo and GitHub Pages
item.description: I’ve been thinking about starting a personal blog around software and the like. I’ve recently been hanging around in the golang subreddit, and came across Hugo - a super-fast static site generator written in go. This is the start of my blog! Resources used for setting up the blog Hugo - Host on GitHub Creating a Hugo site on GitHub Pages by Dillon Gavlock GitHub Pages Basics I’m currently using the awesome hugo-coder theme.
